body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.

Your petitioner would respectfully represent that at the last term of the Fayette Circuit Court he was fined the sum of Two hundred dollars for permitting gaming on premises occupied by him of which offense he says he is not quilty, in fact although he may be in law, He states further that he ^is^ now working out said fine at two dollars per day and the Commonwealth is paying for his accomodations the sum of fifty cents per day. He says he is not doing the Commonwealth nor any one else any good. and says he is desirous of enlisting in the 6th Ky. Cavalry as a private soldier. Wherefore he prays that his fine may be remitted.
Sworn to before me by Lewis Bene this 2nd March 1864

Will A. Stivers N. P.
W. A. STIVERS
NOTARY
PUBLIC
FAYETTE COUNTY, KY.

The undersigned unite in the prayer
of the petitioner, and respectfully ask that he be

Jno B Huston
W C Goodloe
W. P. Downey

Fayette Cir Ct
vs
Lewis Bene
Respite for 6 months
$200-
Remitted on the
22nd Mch 1864
